data.q: Which function in NumPy is used to calculate the mean of an array?
data.e: `np.mean()` computes the arithmetic mean of array elements.

data.q: Which function in NumPy is used to calculate the median of an array?
data.e: `np.median()` returns the median value of the array elements.

data.q: Which function in SciPy is used to perform a t-test?
data.e: `scipy.stats.ttest_ind()` performs a two-sample t-test to compare means of two independent groups.

data.q: Which measure of central tendency is most affected by outliers?
data.e: The mean is sensitive to extreme values, while median and mode are more robust.

data.q: Which function in NumPy is used to calculate the standard deviation?
data.e: `np.std()` computes the standard deviation of array elements.

data.q: Which distribution is commonly used to model the probability of a binary outcome?
data.e: The binomial distribution models the probability of success/failure outcomes.

data.q: Which function in SciPy is used to calculate the Pearson correlation coefficient?
data.e: `scipy.stats.pearsonr()` computes the Pearson correlation coefficient and p-value.

data.q: Which statistical test is used to compare observed frequencies with expected frequencies?
data.e: The Chi-square test is used to compare observed and expected categorical frequencies.

data.q: Which function in NumPy is used to calculate variance?
data.e: `np.var()` computes the variance of array elements.

data.q: Which statistical test is used to compare means across more than two groups?
data.e: ANOVA (Analysis of Variance) is used to compare means across multiple groups.
